explanation: The list res was initialized with length N, which is too large: the code only fills one entry per full 7-element block, so res should have one element per completed week (N//7). Initializing res with N produces many unused trailing zeros. I fixed the initialization to allocate N//7 entries.
fixed_code:
N = int(input())
A = list(map(int,input().split()))

res = [0]*(N//7)
SUM = 0
for i in range(len(A)):
    SUM += A[i]
    if (i + 1)%7==0:
        res[i//7] = SUM
        SUM = 0

print(res)
